sentences.english: In contrast, the EUR is set to continue to suffer and remains a sell on rallies.
sentences.chinese: 相反，欧元仍会受压，并于汇价上升时遭受沽售。

sentences.english: The pound stayed firm against the dollar in London.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦英镑对美元的汇价坚挺。

sentences.english: Intraday, stocks higher, the warm up sets interest rates to support the greenback.
sentences.chinese: 盘中，美股走高，令套息热情上升，支持汇价。

definition: bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to continue to fall (of share prices)
many-headed/many-layered (authority)/devolved (as opposed to centralized)/pluralistic/(as classifier) number of animals/long term (finance)/long (investment)
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
in a few days/one of these days
moving average index (used in financial analysis)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
